meanings.definition: Move or cause to move at a great speed, typically in a wildly uncontrolled manner.
meanings.sent1: The car hurtled down the hill, going very fast.
meanings.sent2: She hurtled through the crowd to catch the bus.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel hurtled across the yard, surprising the cat.
meanings.sent4: The spaceship hurtled through the galaxy like a shooting star.
meanings.sent5: The roller coaster hurtled down the track, thrilling the riders.

meanings.definition: Throw or impel (someone or something) with great force.
meanings.sent1: He hurtled the ball across the field to his teammate.
meanings.sent2: The storm hurtled debris against the windows.
meanings.sent3: The chef hurtled the pizza dough high into the air, impressing the customers.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind hurtled the leaves off the trees.
meanings.sent5: The catapult hurtled the boulder towards the castle walls.
